remarks: Principle of Mathematical Induction, using a bound-variable hypothesis instead of distinct variables.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 6-May-2018.)
statement:
nnindf.x $e |- F/ y ph $.
nnindf.1 $e |- ( x = 1 -> ( ph <-> ps ) ) $.
nnindf.2 $e |- ( x = y -> ( ph <-> ch ) ) $.
nnindf.3 $e |- ( x = ( y + 1 ) -> ( ph <-> th ) ) $.
nnindf.4 $e |- ( x = A -> ( ph <-> ta ) ) $.
nnindf.5 $e |- ps $.
nnindf.6 $e |- ( y e. NN -> ( ch -> th ) ) $.
nnindf $p |- ( A e. NN -> ta ) $.
$d A x $.
$d ch x $.
$d ps x $.
$d ta x $.
$d th x $.
$d x y $.
